description: This trap indicates that the maximum number of entries in this MAC table has exceeded the set 15-minute threshold.

event.Summary: MAC table 15-minute threshold exceeded on port $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ADTRAN-GENMAC-MIB::adGenMacEvent15MinMaxEntriesTCA SNMPv2-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE ADTRAN-GENPORT-MIB::adGenPortTrapIdentifier s EXAMPLE IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999

description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed
node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified
domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is
the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysName

description: A character string to identify the name of a port.
Used for trap varbind in last trap sent.
Should default to port number string.
Can be overridden by customer as desired.
variables.name: ADTRAN-GENPORT-MIB::adGenPortTrapIdentifier

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex

description: This trap indicates that the maximum number of entries in this MAC table has exceeded the set 24-hour threshold.

event.Summary: MAC table 24-hour threshold exceeded on port $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ADTRAN-GENMAC-MIB::adGenMacEvent24HrMaxEntriesTCA SNMPv2-MIB::sysName s EXAMPLE ADTRAN-GENPORT-MIB::adGenPortTrapIdentifier s EXAMPLE IF-MIB::ifIndex i 9999

description: An administratively-assigned name for this managed
node. By convention, this is the node's fully-qualified
domain name. If the name is unknown, the value is
the zero-length string.
variables.name: SNMPv2-MIB::sysName

description: A character string to identify the name of a port.
Used for trap varbind in last trap sent.
Should default to port number string.
Can be overridden by customer as desired.
variables.name: ADTRAN-GENPORT-MIB::adGenPortTrapIdentifier

description: A unique value, greater than zero, for each interface. It
is recommended that values are assigned contiguously
starting from 1. The value for each interface sub-layer
must remain constant at least from one re-initialization of
the entity's network management system to the next re-
initialization.
variables.name: IF-MIB::ifIndex
